name: Sea Slug
description:
A very tall, plump woman with pale pink skin. Completely smeared in mucus, her colorful skin glistens in the sunlight strongly. Her bottom half resembles that of a slug, drooling moisture and mucus on the sandy beach. Reddish gel-like substance on her head manages to cover most of her face, resembling poofy hair with long bangs.

A tasteful frilly bikini bottom covers her pubic region but her immense bosom remains uncovered, resting heavily against her chest.
encyclopedia:
Mollusc women who prefer to populate intertidal zones of sea shores. Incredibly slippery and coming in variety of shapes, they sometimes get mistaken for a subspecies of slimes by inexperienced adventurers. Their impressive size allows them to move with surprisng speed at times, but their lazy disposition largely offsets that advantage. They have a tendency to travel in very large groups, but when hunting for mates they prefer to go alone or in pairs.

Sea Slugs attack humans with a variety of smothering moves, using their excessive mucus to enhance the attacks. To make matters worse, their mucus contains a sensitizing agent and a muscle relaxant. Prolonged exposure is ill-adviced.

Despite the number of dangerous traits, Sea Slugs rarely exhibit overly aggressive behavior and prefer to take it easy even when battling. Many of them are fairly dense, failing to pick up on more subtle conversation implications.
